detaileddescription.para: First word in every HIPO file for identification purposes.
First word in every Evio file for identification purposes.
Number of 32-bit words in a normal sized header.
Number of bytes in a normal sized header.
Magic number used to track endianness.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the file id.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the file number.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the header length.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the record count.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the index array length.
Byte offset from beginning of header to bit info word.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the user header length.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the record length.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the user register #1.
Byte offset from beginning of header to write trailer position.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the user integer #1.
Byte offset from beginning of header to the user integer #2.
8th bit set in bitInfo word in record/file header means contains dictionary.
9th bit set in bitInfo word in file header means every split file has same first event.
10th bit set in bitInfo word in file header means file trailer with index array exists.
File id for file identification purposes. Defaults to HIPO file. 1st word.
File number or split file number, starting at 1. 2nd word.
User-defined 64-bit register. 9th and 10th words.
Position of trailing header from start of file in bytes. 11th word.
First user-defined integer in file header. 13th word.
Second user-defined integer in file header. 14th word.
Position of this header in a file.
Event or record count. 4th word.
BitInfo & version. 6th word.
Length of this header (bytes).
Length of this header (words). 3rd word.
Length of user-defined header (bytes). 7th word.
Length of user-defined header when padded (words).
Length of index array (bytes). 5th word.
Final, total length of header + index + user header (bytes) + padding. Not stored in any word.
Evio format version number. It is 6 when being written, else the version of file/buffer being read. Lowest byte of 6th word.
Magic number for tracking endianness. 8th word.
Number of bytes required to bring uncompressed user header to 4-byte boundary. Stored in 6th word. Updated automatically when lengths are set.
Byte order of file.
Type of header this is. Normal HIPO record by default.
Default, no-arg constructor.

Copy constructor.

file header to copy.

if true, file has EVIO file id and header type, else is HIPO.

total length of header + index + user header (including padding) in bytes.

length of this header data in bytes.

Get the length of the user-defined header in words.
length of the user-defined header in words.

trailer's (trailing header's) file position in bytes.

Get the bit info word.
bit info word.

Set the bit info word and related values.
word
bit info word.

Set the bit info word for a file header. Retains current header type, user header length padding, and version.
haveFirst
true if file has first event.
haveDictionary
true if file has dictionary in user header.
haveTrailerWithIndex
true if file has trailer with record length index.
new bit info word.

Set the bit which says file has a first event.
hasFirst
true if file has a first event.
new bitInfo word.

Does this header have a first event in the file header?
true if header has a first event in the file header, else false.

Set the bit in the file header which says there is a dictionary.
hasDictionary
true if file has a dictionary.
new bitInfo word.

Does this header have a dictionary in the file header?
true if header has a dictionary in the file header, else false.

Set the bit in the file header which says there is a trailer with a record length index.
hasTrailerWithIndex
true if file has a trailer with a record length index.
new bitInfo word.

Does this file have a trailer with a record length index?
true if file has a trailer with a record length index, else false.

Is this header followed by a user header?
true if header followed by a user header, else false.

Does this file have a valid index of record lengths immediately following header? There should be at least one integer for valid index. Must have integral number of entries.
true if file has a valid index, else false.

a reference to this object.

a reference to this object.

Set the number of record entries. No compression for other values.
n

a reference to this object.

a reference to this object.

Set the this header's length in bytes & words. If length is not a multiple of 4, you're on your own! Sets the total length too.
length
this header's length in bytes.
a reference to this object.

Set the total length in bytes, header + index + user header. This includes padding and is on a 4-byte boundary. Never compressed.
length
total length in bytes, header + index + user header.
a reference to this object.

Writes the file (not record!) header into the given byte buffer.
buf
byte buffer to write file header into.
off
position in buffer to begin writing.
EvioException
if remaining buffer space (limit - off) is too small.

Writes the file (not record!) header into the given byte buffer.
buf
byte buffer to write file header into.
off
position in buffer to begin writing.
EvioException
if remaining buffer space (limit - off) is too small.

Reads the file header information from a byte buffer and validates it by checking the magic word (8th word). This magic word also determines the byte order. The given buffer's position does NOT change.

parameterdescription.para: position of first word to be read.
if remaining buffer space (limit - off) is too small, data is not in proper format, or version earlier than 6.

detaileddescription.para: Reads the file header information from a byte buffer and validates it by checking the magic word (8th word). This magic word also determines the byte order. The given buffer's position does NOT change.

parameterdescription.para: position of first word to be read.
if remaining buffer space (limit - off) is too small, data is not in proper format, or version earlier than 6.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a string representation of the record.
a string representation of the record.
Initialize bitInfo word to proper value.

Decodes the bit-info word into version, padding and header type.
word
bit-info word.

Set the user header's padding - the number of bytes required to bring uncompressed user header to 4-byte boundary. Sets the associated value in bitInfo word.
padding
user header's padding.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t version, bool hasDictionary, bool hasFirst, bool trailerWithIndex, uint32_t headerType=1)
memberdef.name: generateBitInfoWord

detaileddescription.para: Calculates the bit info (6th) word of this header which has the version number in the lowest 8 bits (0-7). The arg hasDictionary is set in the 8th bit, hasFirst is set in the 9th bit, and trailerWithIndex is set in the 10th bit. Four bits of this header type are set in bits 28-31 (defaults to 1 which is an evio file header).

parameterdescription.para: does this file include an evio xml dictionary?
does this file include a first event in every file split?
does this file have a trailer with an event index?
4 bit type of this header (defaults to 1 which is an evio file header).

simplesect.para: generated bit-info (6th) word of a file header.

detaileddescription.para:
Does this bitInfo arg indicate the existence of a first event in the file header? Static.
bitInfo
bitInfo word.
true if header has a first event in the file header, else false.

Does this bitInfo arg indicate the existence of a dictionary in the file header?
bitInfo
bitInfo word.
true if header has a dictionary in the file header, else false.

Does this bitInfo arg indicate the existence of a trailer with a record length index?
bitInfo
bitInfo word.
true if file has a trailer with a record length index, else false.

para.preformatted: FILE HEADER STRUCTURE ( 56 bytes, 14 integers (32 bit) )

------------------- Bit Info Word ------------------- 0-7 = version 8 = true if dictionary is included (relevant for first record only) 9 = true if this file has "first" event (in every split file) 10 = File trailer with index array of record lengths exists 11-19 = reserved 20-21 = pad 1 22-23 = pad 2 24-25 = pad 3 (always 0) 26-27 = reserved 28-31 = general header type: 1 = Evio file 2 = Evio extended file 5 = HIPO file 6 = HIPO extended file
